intro: Diodia rogaguana, commonly known as creeping dill. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that releases tiny seeds when mature.
